row.english: There's no such thing as an even match
row.notes: Even [perfectly matched Go opponents>相碁 require a [handicap of 9 stones>井目 to be played
row.jpn: 人の実力の差はさまざまで、何をするにも力の差はあるものだということ。

row.english: ① Plum flower ② Plum tree
row.notes: In the darkness暗 their scent香 lingers, and they cast a faint疎 shadow影 in the moonlight
row.jpn: 梅の花や梅の木。

row.notes: Peaceful安寧 and orderly秩序
row.jpn: 社会が落ち着いていて秩序立っていること。

row.notes: Celestial realm in Buddhism
row.jpn: 仏教で阿弥陀仏のいるところ。

row.notes: 唯唯=saying 'yes sir!'; 諾諾=acquiescing
row.jpn: 物事のよしあしにかかわらず、なんでもはいはいと承知すること。相手の言葉に逆らわずおもねること。

row.notes: Lingering遺 regret憾; 千・万 often used to represent 'a great amount'
row.jpn: 非常に残念なこと。

row.notes: Something with a foreign異国 feeling情緒 to it
row.jpn: いかにも外国らしい風物がかもしだす雰囲気や気分。

row.notes: Stench臭 remains遺 for millenia万載
row.jpn: 悪名や悪い評判を後世まで残すこと。

row.english: The fool lives only for self enrichment
row.notes: The fool uses以 his body身 and martyrs殉 himself for profit利; The source phrase continues: the warrior gives himself for honor, the patriarch gives himself for the home, the saint gives himself for the world
row.jpn: つまらない人間は自分の利と欲のためにのみ生きるということ。

row.english: Same rhyming pattern from start to finish
row.notes: Single一 rhyming韻 pattern until reaching到 the end底
row.jpn: 古詩の韻の踏み方のひとつで、同一の韻を最初から最後まで用いること。

row.english: Someone who always needs to get in the last word
row.notes: 一言=one word, 居士=name suffix; Like calling someone Mr. 'Always Needs the Last Word'
row.jpn: 事あるごとに自分の意見をひとこと言わなければ気のすまない人のこと。

row.notes: One一 soup汁, one一 salad菜
row.jpn: 質素な食事のたとえ。

row.english: Hard work now makes for a easy life later
row.notes: One一 labor労, then forever永 at ease安逸; Ban Gu (班固) wrote of Dou Xian (竇憲) of the Later Han period, commenting how Xian's successful military campaign afforded him the luxury of an easy life.
row.jpn: 一度苦労すれば、長くその利を得られること。また、わずかの苦労で多くの安楽が得られること。

row.notes: All一切 [living things>衆生
row.jpn: この世に生を受けたあらゆるもの。生きとし生けるもの。

row.english: With all your might; With everything you got
row.notes: A samurai staking懸 their life on protecting one一 place所
row.jpn: 真剣にものごとに打ち込むこと。

row.english: The needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few
row.notes: One一 person killed殺 so many多 can live生
row.jpn: ひとりの人間を犠牲にして多くの人を救い生かすこと。

row.notes: One一 morning朝, suddenly wealthy富貴
row.jpn: にわかに富貴な身になること。

row.english: Working with great care and respect
row.notes: When carving a likeness of the Buddha, for every one一 cut刀, make 3三 bows礼 of respect; ※礼＝らい due to Buddhist origin
row.jpn: 慎重かつ敬虔な態度で仕事をすること。

row.english: Recognition from an influential person earns recognition from the public many times over
row.notes: Once一 you climb登 dragon's竜 gate門, you will achieve success; Refers to 登竜門: If a carp could surmount登 Ryumon竜門, known as the swift currents of the upper Yellow River, that carp would transform into a dragon
row.jpn: その時代の有力者に認められば、その人の価値は世間から十倍にも評価されるということ。

row.english: Stubborn denial without consideration of the facts
row.notes: With one一 stroke of the brush筆, obliterate抹殺
row.jpn: よく考えることなく、事実や存在を全面的に否定すること。

row.english: ① Passing down the master's teachings ② Transmission of the dharma
row.notes: Robe衣 and bowl鉢 inheritance相伝. Passing down of items used for mendicancy as metaphor for passage of teachings.
row.jpn: 弟子が師の教えを継ぐこと。

row.notes: Mind意 is racing like a horse馬, heart心 is chaotic like a monkey猿
row.jpn: 煩悩や妄念のために心が乱れ落ち着かないことのたとえ。

row.reading: いんきょうじゅうねん
row.notes: Understanding the Yunjing韻鏡 takes 10十 years年. The Yunjing is compilation of kanji pronunciation tables produced in China hundreds of years ago.
row.jpn: 理解することが非常に難しいこと。

row.notes: Drinking飲 to至 your ancestors and recording upon bamboo策 your deeds勲
row.jpn: 勝ち戦のあと、先祖への報告の酒を飲み、その功績を竹の札に書き記すこと。

row.english: Never let them see you sweat
row.notes: Hide隠 endurance忍 to maintain self自 respect重. Heavy(重) meaning to place heavy emphasis on something, i.e., honor or respect it.
row.jpn: 苦しみなどをじっとこらえて軽々しい行動をとらないこと。

row.notes: After drinking, feeling like you could transform化 to have wings羽 and rise登 to heaven become a immortal仙
row.jpn: 酒を飲むなどしてよい気持ちになることのたとえ。

row.english: ① Crazy weather ② Life's many challenges
row.notes: Rain雨 dew露 frost霜 and snow雪
row.jpn: 気象がいろいろ変化すること。また、日常生活におけるさまざまな困難のこと。

row.notes: 雲水 is a term for Buddhist monks on a pilgrimage行脚 because they wander as clouds雲 move and water水 flows.
row.jpn: 修行僧が諸国をめぐって、仏法を修行すること。

row.notes: Like clouds雲 and mud泥, 10,000万 miles里 apart in terms of quality/ability/value etc.
row.jpn: 比較にならないほど大きな差異のこと。

row.notes: Eternal永 and with no無 limit窮
row.jpn: 永久に続くことのたとえ。

row.notes: 英俊 and 豪傑 both mean 'exceptional person'
row.jpn: 多くの中で特にすぐれた人物。

row.notes: Turn回 light光 and shine照 back返 upon the self
row.jpn: 仏教で、自分のあるべき姿をふり返り、反省して修行に励むこと。

row.english: Every meeting leads to a farewell
row.notes: People者 who meet会 will definitely定 part離.
row.jpn: この世は無常であることのたとえ。

row.notes: The bird鳥 from Yue越 makes its nest with branches枝 from the South南.
row.syn: 胡馬北風,狐死首丘,池魚故淵
row.jpn: 故郷が懐かしく忘れがたいこと。

row.notes: Often used as 遠慮会釈もない to indicate a tactless approach.
row.jpn: 他人のことを考えて応対をつつましく控え目にすること。

row.reading: おうこうしょうしょう
row.notes: King王, nobles侯, generals将 and ministers相 (首相).
row.jpn: 王者と諸侯と将軍と大臣。高貴な身分のこと。

row.english: Desire to enter the Pure Land
row.notes: The pure素 desire懷 to be reborn往生 in the Pure Land
row.jpn: 仏教に帰依して死んだ後に極楽浄土に行うと願う平素からの希望。

row.reading: おんりょうきょうけん
row.notes: [Warm and kind>温良, respectful恭倹
row.jpn: 性質がおだやかで、つつましやかなこと。

row.kun: 海(うみ)の角(すみ)、天(テン)の涯(は)て
row.english: ① The ends of the earth ② Extremely far
row.notes: The corners角 of the sea海 and ends涯 of the heavens天
row.jpn: きわめて遠く離れていることのたとえ。

row.english: Ceremony wherein the eyes are added to a statue of Buddha and his spirit is welcomed to reside within
row.notes: Note 開眼 is かい*げん*. Buddhist-related terms often have unique readings.
row.jpn: 新たに造った仏像に目を入れて、仏の魂を迎える儀式。

row.english: A temporary method to lead towards the truth
row.notes: The truth revealed開 beyond the temporary権 method is the appearance顕 of the truth真. According to the Lotus Sutra, the three vehicles Śrāvaka (disciple), Pratyekabuddha (Solitary Buddha), and Bodhisattva compose a set of teachings that lead into the one true vehicle for becoming buddha.
row.jpn: 仮の姿であることをうち明けて、真の姿を明らかにすること。

row.notes: Burned-out ash灰 for one's heart心 and loss喪 of spirit気
row.jpn: 失意のあまり元気をなくすこと。

row.notes: 誓・盟 mean oath, while ocean海 and mountain山 are examples of being eternally unchanging
row.jpn: きわめて堅い誓い。

row.kun: 快(こころよ)い刀(かたな)で乱(みだ)れた麻(あさ)を断つ
row.notes: Solving a complicated issue swiftly and decisively, like a fine快 blade刀 cutting through tangled乱 hemp麻
row.jpn: こじれた物事を、手ぎわよく処理・解決すること。

row.kun: 嫁鶏(カケイ)、鶏(ケイ)に随(したが)う
row.notes: The wife嫁 chicken鶏 following随 the male chicken鶏
row.jpn: 妻が夫に従うことのたとえ。

row.notes: Having seen見 little寡 and heard聞 little少. Usu 寡聞少見
row.jpn: 見聞がせまく、わずかな知識しかないこと。

row.english: The beauty of nature untouched by man
row.notes: Flowers花 of red紅 and willows柳 of green緑. Comes from Zen Buddhism.
row.jpn: 人の手を加えていない自然のままの美しさのこと。

row.notes: Opposite of 正当防衛 (self defense)
row.jpn: 自分を守るために一定の限度を超えて応戦すること。

row.notes: Few数 heads頭 compose the government政治
row.jpn: 少数者が統治権をにぎって行う政治。

row.notes: Misfortune禍 and fortune福, gain得 and loss喪
row.jpn: わざわいにあったり、幸いにあったり、成功して出世したり、位を失ったりすること。

row.english: As one makes their bed, so must they lie in it
row.notes: Misfortune禍 and fortune福 have no無 gate門 from which they enter. They are invited depending on one's actions.
row.jpn: わざわいや福はその人自身が招くものだということ。

row.notes: Having heard聞 little少 and seen見 little寡
row.jpn: 見聞がせまく、わずかな知識しかないこと。

row.notes: Little寡 honesty廉 and little鮮 shame恥
row.jpn: 心が清く正しくなく恥知らずなこと。

row.reading: かんぎゅうじゅうとう
row.english: A veritable mountain or sea of literature
row.notes: So many books, it would make an ox牛 sweat汗 trying to pull them, or fill充 a room up to the rafter棟
row.jpn: 蔵書が非常に多いことのたとえ。

row.english: Fishing alone in the cold river snow
row.notes: Cold寒 river江 lone独 fisher釣. From the poem River Snow (江雪) by Liu Zongyuan (柳宗元).
row.jpn: 冬の川で雪の中一人で釣りをする人の姿。

row.notes: 寛仁 and 大度 refer to magnanimity and having good character
row.jpn: 心が広くて慈悲深く、度量が大きいこと。

row.kun: 善(ゼン)を勧(すす)めて、悪(アク)を懲(こ)らす
row.notes: Praise勧 good善 condemn懲 evil悪
row.jpn: 善行を奨励して、悪行を懲らしめ、悪い行いをしないようにしむけること

row.english: All mixed up; Ass-backwards or back-asswards
row.notes: Crown冠, shoes履, upside-down倒, switched易
row.jpn: 上下の順序が乱れること。

row.english: Back to the main point...; Getting back on track...
row.notes: 閑話 is an aside or a topic secondary to the main topic. 休題 is to put a topic to rest.
row.jpn: それはさておき。

row.kun: 外(そと)は柔(やわ)らかい、内(うち)は剛(つよ)し
row.english: A gentle countenance hiding a fierce will; An iron fist in a velvet glove
row.notes: Outside外 appears gentle柔, but inside内 is strong剛 and fierce
row.jpn: 外見は穏やかそうに見えるが、実際は意志が強いこと。

row.english: Blending proper and colloquial writing techniques
row.notes: (NULL)
row.jpn: 風雅なものと卑俗なものとを適当に取捨して用いること。

row.kun: 蛇(へび)を画(えが)きて足(あし)を添(そ)う
row.notes: Drawing画 a snake蛇 and adding添 feet足. From a story where several men hold a competition to see who can draw a snake the fastest. The winner gets a drink of wine. One man draws faster than everyone, but gets cocky and adds feet to his snake as a joke. However, another man points out that snakes have no feet, disqualifying the first man's drawing, and he claims the drink for himself.
row.jpn: 無用なものをつけ促すこと。

row.english: Chaging alignment, making and breaking alliances, to suit your needs
row.notes: 合従 or 合縦 refers to 'vertical' North-South alliance of Zhao趙, Wei魏, Han韓, Yan燕, Qi斉 and Chu楚 that resisted the nation of Qin秦 during the Warring States Period. 連衡 refers to 'horizontal' East-West alliances that Zhang Yi (張儀) worked to create between Qin秦 and each of the six countries of the 'vertical alliance' so Qin秦 could ultimately unify China.
row.jpn: その時の利害に応じて、団結したり離れたりすること。

row.english: Charging forward with reckless abandon in single-minded pursuit or with intense focus
row.notes: Comes from 我貪り (がむさぼり), a voracious focus on self-interest
row.jpn: 向こう見ずにひたすら突き進むこと。

row.notes: 頑固 is stubborn and 一徹 is to follow one thing through to the end
row.jpn: 一度決めたらあくまでも意地をはって押し通すこと。

row.english: Art or literature full of energy and showing refined artistic sensibility
row.notes: 気韻 is refined aesthetics. 生動 is lively and vibrant
row.jpn: 絵画や文章などに、生き生きとした気品や情趣があふれていること。

row.english: Having great imagination and unique way of thinking
row.notes: The vastness宇 of your spirit気 is magnificent壮大
row.jpn: 心構えや発想が大きくて立派なこと。

row.notes: 吉 and 福 represent fortune, 凶 and 禍 misfortune
row.jpn: 幸いとわざわい。

row.english: Becoming a devout believer of Buddhism
row.notes: 帰命 is to dedicate your life to the teachings of Buddha. 頂礼 is to kowtow, a method of showing ultimate respect.
row.jpn: 仏に心から帰依すること。

row.notes: Put on a demon鬼 face面 and threaten嚇 a person人
row.jpn: 見せかけの威力で人をおどしつけること。

row.notes: The distressed窮 monkey猿 throws投 itself into the forest林 and has no time to choose what branch to swing from
row.jpn: 困っているときには、あれこれ選り好みなどしていられないということ。

row.notes: 窮 and 幽 both refer to being tucked away and secluded.
row.jpn: 奥深くて静かな山と谷のこと。

row.reading: きゅうちょうにゅうかい
row.notes: A bird鳥 in distress窮 flying into入 a hunter's pocket懐
row.jpn: 追いつめられた人が助けを求めすがること。

row.notes: 窮途 is a dead-end street. 末路 is the end of the road.
row.jpn: 追いつめられて苦境から逃れようもない状態。

row.kun: 年(とし)を窮(きわ)め世(よ)を累(かさ)ぬ
row.english: As long as my lineage survives
row.notes: Till the end窮 of my years年 and through the combined累 generations世 of my family
row.jpn: 自分も生きている限り、孫子の代までも。いつまでも。

row.notes: A一 plan策 for an excess余 of distress窮
row.jpn: 追いつめられて苦しまぎれに思いつく手段・方策。

row.reading: きょうかくさつぎゅう
row.on: キョウカクサツギュウ
row.kun: 角(つの)を矯(た)めて牛(うし)を殺(ころ)す
row.english: Trying too hard to fix something and making it worse
row.notes: Try to straighten矯 the horns角 and end up killing殺 the cow牛
row.jpn: 少しの欠点を直そうとして、かえって全体をだめにしてしまうこと。

row.kun: 幹(みき)を強(つよ)くし、枝(えだ)を弱(よわ)くす
row.notes: Strengthen強 the trunk幹 (central imperial palace), weaken弱 the branches枝 (regional institutions)
row.jpn: 地方の権限を抑えて、中央の権力を強くすること。

row.reading: きょうきょうきんげん
row.english: Phrase used to close a letter, e.g., Sincerely Yours
row.notes: Humble恐恐 and respectful謹 words言
row.jpn: 恐れながらつつしんで申し上げるということ。

row.reading: きょうきんしゅうれい
row.notes: 胸襟 refers to the thoughts within your heart. 秀麗 is superb and beautiful.
row.jpn: 物事に対する考え方が正しくりっぱなこと。

row.notes: Interest興味 depleted索然
row.jpn: 関心が薄れていくこと。また、おもしろみがなく物足りないこと。

row.notes: Interest興味 overflowing津津
row.jpn: (NULL)

row.english: Carrying oneself properly and striving for knowledge
row.notes: Living居 with respect敬 and seeking ultimate窮 truth理
row.jpn: 日常の振る舞いをつつしみ、物事の道理をきわめて正確な知識を得ること。

row.notes: Hang懸 a mirror鏡 in an empty虚 room堂
row.jpn: 心をむなしくして公平・無心にものを見ることのたとえ。

row.notes: Play the koto琴 and sing歌, drink wine酒 and recite賦 poetry
Strumming the koto琴, playing Go棋, writing書 and drawing画
row.jpn: 教養のある人のたしなみのこと。

row.english: Focusing one's life on the military arts
row.notes: 謹倹 is short for 勤勉倹約, which is diligence勤勉 and frugality倹約. 尚武 is to show respect and place importance on military arts.
row.jpn: 生活を質素にして、武芸に励むこと

row.notes: Respectful謹・慎 in speech言 and action行
row.jpn: 言葉や行いを慎重にすること。

row.notes: Respectful謹 upright厳 truthful実 straightfoward直
row.jpn: きわめてつつしみ深く誠実で正直なこと。

row.notes: Golden金 branches枝 and jeweled玉 leaves葉
row.jpn: 天子の一族・子孫のこと。

row.english: An exceptionally talented pair of brothers
row.notes: A golden金 [younger brother>友 and jeweled玉 [older brother>昆
row.jpn: 才能や学問にすぐれた兄弟のこと。

row.english: ① An exceptionally strange or mysterious item ② A crude and vulgar person
row.notes: 神 and 鬼 refer to a strange creature beyond human comprehension, in this case, with a ox牛 head and snake蛇 tail
row.jpn: 作品などのきわめて奇抜なことのたとえ。また、人柄が卑しくて心がねじけている人のたとえ。

row.english: All come from dust and to dust all return
row.notes: Jewels玉 (learned men) and rocks石 (fools) are broken砕 all the same同 in the end
row.jpn: よいものも悪いものも、賢者も愚者もともに滅びてなくなるたとえ。

row.notes: Jeweled玉 leaves葉 and golden金 branches枝. Usu 金枝玉葉
row.jpn: 天子の一族・子孫のこと。

row.english: An exceptionally talented pair of brothers
row.notes: A jeweled玉 [older brother>昆 and golden金 [younger brother>弟
row.jpn: 才能や学問にすぐれた兄弟のこと。

row.english: ① Endless expanse ② Vague and indistinct
row.notes: 空漠 is boundless and vague, repeated for emphasis
row.jpn: 果てしもなく広いさま。また、非常にぼんやりしたさま。

row.notes: Idol偶像 worship崇拝. Having absolute blind faith in a figurehead.
row.jpn: 偶像を崇拝的な対象としてあがめ尊ぶこと。

row.notes: Their bodies形 and shadows影 and always in the same一如 location
row.jpn: 仲のよい夫婦のたとえ。

row.english: All alone, without a soul to depend on
row.notes: Your body形 and shadow影 mourning弔 [each other>相 since there's no one else to care
row.jpn: 孤独で訪れる人もないさま。

row.notes: 軽挙 is to take hasty action. 妄動 is to act without thinking.
row.jpn: 事の是非をわきまえず、軽はずみに行動すること。

row.notes: A plan案 to use fireflies蛍 and snow雪 on the window窓 to study
row.jpn: 苦労して勉学に励むこと

row.english: Don't trust those too eager to please
row.notes: Flippant軽 agreement諾 earns little寡 trust信
row.jpn: 簡単にうけあう者は信用できないということ。

row.english: Do not envy the wise man, strive to be like him
row.notes: When you see見 a wise賢 man, think思 of equaling斉 him
row.jpn: 賢人に接したときは見習って自分もそのような人になりたいと思うこと。

row.reading: けんしょうじょうぶつ
row.notes: Seeing見 your true character性 and achieving成 Buddhahood仏
row.jpn: おのれに本来備わる仏心を見極め、悟りの境地に達すること。

row.english: Making a decision and sticking with it
row.notes: 堅忍 is having strong unyielding patience. 果決 is a bold decision.
row.jpn: 我慢強く堪え忍び、いったん決めると果敢に断行すること。

row.notes: 堅忍 is having strong unyielding patience. 質直 is straightforward and honest.
row.jpn: 我慢強くてまっすぐな気性をしていること。

row.notes: 堅忍 is having strong unyielding patience. 不抜 is refusing to withdraw.
row.jpn: 意志を固く持ち、どんな困難にも絶え心を動かさないこと。

row.notes: Hang懸 your arm腕 in the air away from the body, and let the brush筆 hang straight直 down from the hand
row.jpn: 書法の一つ。

row.notes: Charge-off償却 for a reduction減 in value価 of a fixed asset
row.jpn: 年数の経過で価値の減少する固定資産の減損額を、各合計年度に割りあてて回収する会計上の手続き。

row.english: Singing like no one is listening
row.notes: Both 歌 and 吟 mean to sing. 高 is with a high voice and 放 is to let loose without reservation.
row.jpn: あたりかまわず大声で歌い吟ずること。

row.english: Punishing offical corruption and restoring order through regulations
row.notes: A large cord綱 and small cord紀 represent bindings of law and order. 粛正 means restoring order.
row.jpn: 乱れた規律を正すこと。

row.english: A fumbled but earnest attempt still beats the most adept deception
row.notes: An adept巧 deception偽 is worse than something unskilled拙 but honest誠
row.jpn: 巧みに偽ることと、拙くとまごころがあること。

row.english: ① In perfect agreement ② An superbly accurate reading or analysis
row.notes: Yellow黄 pongee絹, youthful幼 wife婦. From the late Eastern Han漢 period. Cao Cao (曹操) and one of his officials Yang Xiu (楊修) came upon the stele of Cao E (曽娥). Cao E was a young girl who died retrieving her father's drowned corpse from a river and was praised for her filial piety. The back of the stele contained 8 characters: 黃絹幼婦 外孫虀臼, literally 'yellow黃 pongee絹, younthful幼 wife婦, maternal外 grandson孫, leeks虀 ground in a mortar臼.' Yang Xiu deduced the following: Yellow pongee is colored色 thread糸, forming the character utterly絶; youthful wife is young少 woman女, forming the character marvelous妙; maternal grandson is a woman's女 child子, forming the character lovely好; and leeks ground in a mortar is to receive受 their pungent辛 smell, forming the character words辭(辞). Therefore, Yang Xiu reasoned the 8 characters were a riddle meaning 'Utterly marvelous lovely words.' Cao Cao walked 30 li里 while puzzling it out in his head and eventually came to the same conclusion. (Source: Richard B. Mather, Shih-shuo Hsin-yü: A New Account of Tales of the World, Minneapolis: University of Minnesota Press, 1976, pp. 293–294)
row.jpn: 二人の判断がまったく一致していること。また、解釈や判読がすばらしく正確なこと。

row.kun: 災(わざわ)いを幸(さいわ)いとし、禍(わざわ)いを楽(たの)しむ
row.notes: Find happiness幸 in another's misfortune災, enjoy楽 another's misfortune禍
row.jpn: 他人の不幸を見てよろこぶこと。

row.english: Better quick and sloppy than perfect and late
row.notes: Skilled巧 and late遅 is still worse than sloppy拙 and quick速. Originally referred to military tactics.
row.jpn: じょうずで遅いより、へたでも速いほうがよいの意。

row.english: A match made through red leaves
row.notes: Red紅 leaves葉 are a good良 matchmaker媒. From a classic Chinese story set during the rule of Emperor Xizong of Tang (唐僖宗). One day, Yu You (于祐) finds a red leaf floating down a stream in the palace garden. The leaf has a poem written on it. Yu You picks up the leaf, then writes his own poem upon a separate leaf and sends it down the stream. His leaf is found by court lady Han Cuiping (韓夫人), who crafted the original leaf poem. The two eventually meet and marry.
row.jpn: 紅葉が緑の仲人。

row.english: Humble self-referential phrase for lords and nobles
row.notes: 孤 and 寡 are terms of humility meaning lords and nobles. 不穀 is unworthy.
row.jpn: 王侯の自称。

row.english: A peaceful society ruled by a benevolent government
row.notes: People celebrating by slapping their stomachs腹 like drums鼓 and striking撃 the earth壌 in rhythm
row.jpn: 理想的な政治がゆきとどいて、人々が平和な生活をすること。

row.notes: The epitome到・至 of kindness懇・切
row.jpn: ねんごろに真心から親切を尽くすこと。

row.english: Sincere and strong of body and mind
row.notes: 剛健 is strong and healthy. 質実 is sincere of character. Usu 質実剛健
row.jpn: 飾りけがなくまじめで、心身ともに強くたくましいこと。

row.notes: Paradise in the afterlife where Amitābha (阿弥陀仏) resides
row.jpn: 仏教で、阿弥陀仏がいるという安楽の世界のこと。

row.notes: 五倫 are five categories governing ethical behavior: kindness between parent and child, duty between servant and master, divide between husband and wife, hierarchy between young and old, and trust between friends. 五常 are five constants of moral behavior: virtue, justice, manners, wisdom and trust.
row.jpn: 人としてふみ守らなければならない道徳のこと。

row.english: Even the fair and righteous have self-interests
row.notes: 五倫 is Diwu Lun (第五倫), and 十起 references the idiom 一夜十起, which illustrates how self-interest can overcome even the most altruistic of people.
row.jpn: 清廉公正な者にも私心はあるということ。

row.english: The Pure Land home of Amitābha
row.notes: Western西方 area of [Pure Land>浄土
row.jpn: 阿弥陀仏の在す極楽浄土。

row.kun: 足(あし)を削(けず)りて履(くつ)に適(てき)せしむ
row.english: Putting the cart before the horse
row.notes: Shaving削 down your foot足 to be the appropriate適 size for a shoe履
row.jpn: 目先のことに気をとられて、大事なことを忘れてしまうこと。

row.english: Clouds forming around a bridge or rains falling in a ravine
row.notes: Bridge桟 clouds雲 and ravine峡 rain雨
row.jpn: かけ橋の付近に起こる雲と谷あいに落る雨。

row.notes: Through life and rebirth, people are in continuous flux流転 between the three三 realms界: the desire realm, the form realm and the formless realm.
row.jpn: いのちのあるものはすべて、前世・現世・来世の三世にわたって、生死を繰り返し迷いつづけるということ。

row.notes: An area of land that wears a collar襟 of mountains山 and a belt帯 of rivers河, i.e., surrounded by natural barriers
row.jpn: 自然の要害のこと。

row.notes: Wash浴 three三 times, lather with perfumes薫 three三 times
row.jpn: 相手を大切に思う心をあらわす語。

row.notes: Sinful罪 works業 erase消 and destroy滅
row.jpn: 現世の悪い行いも、仏道修行によって消し去ることができるということ。

row.notes: 残酷 and 非道 both mean awful, inhumane and cruel actions that go against common morals and decency.
row.jpn: むごたらしくて人道にそむいた行い。

row.english: A landscape or nation ravaged by war
row.notes: Only rivers水 and mountains山 remain剰・残
row.jpn: 戦乱のあとに残った荒廃した山や川の自然。

row.notes: 残忍 is cruelty and 酷薄 both refer to a lack of humanity or decency.
row.jpn: 思いやりがなくむごいこと。

row.notes: Poetry詩, song歌, winds管 and strings弦
row.jpn: 文学と音楽のこと。

row.notes: Epitome至 of respect恭 and obedience順 towards another's words
row.jpn: 人の言動にいたってすなおに従うこと。

row.notes: Careful thought思索 and reasoning over something gives birth生 to knowledge知
row.jpn: 筋道をたどって物事をよく考えることによって、知恵がうまれるということ。

row.english: Large of ambition, little of talent
row.notes: Ambition志 is great大 but talent才 is sparse疎
row.jpn: 志は大きいが才能が乏しいこと。

row.notes: Epitome至 of bigness大 and epitome至 of toughness剛
row.jpn: ものすごく大きくて、ものすごく強い。

row.notes: Seven七 brings difficulties難 and nine九 misfortune厄. Based on superstition that years of age ending in 7 or 9 are unlucky.
row.jpn: 七と九との年まわり「十七歳や四十歳など」では、男女とも災厄にあいがちだという俗信。

row.english: Swift as the wind, quick as lightning
row.notes: Swift疾 as the wind風, quick迅 as lightning雷
row.jpn: 行動がすばやく激しいさま。

row.english: Sincere and strong of mind and body
row.notes: 質実 is sincere of character. 剛健 is strong and healthy.
row.jpn: 飾りけがなくまじめで、心身ともに強くたくましいこと。

row.notes: 紫電 is a beautiful and magnificent as a flash of lightning. 清霜 is moral purity like fresh sparking frost.
row.jpn: 容姿がすぐれて節操の堅い形容。

row.notes: Refers to how Che Yin (車胤) and Sun Kung (孫康) overcame poverty to excel at their studies. Both of their families were poor and could not afford oil for lamps to study at night. Yin collected fireflies蛍 in a small net fashioning a makeshift hanging light, while Kung used moonlight reflecting off the snow雪.
row.jpn: 苦学のたとえ

row.english: ① Focusing needlessly on details ignoring the heart of the matter ② Focusing on symptoms without curing the disease
row.notes: Disregarding捨 the roots根 and focusing注 on the branches枝
row.jpn: 大切でない部分に心を奪われて、物事の根本を忘れること。また、本質的な原因を探究しないで結果だけを問題にすること。

row.notes: Block遮 the next二 step from your mind as there is no無 next二 step. Proceeding with haste and without a thought for what comes next.
row.jpn: がむしゃらに。

row.kun: 本(もと)を舎(す)てて末(すえ)を逐(お)う
row.english: ① Focusing needlessly on details ignoring the heart of the matter ② Focusing on symptoms without curing the disease
row.notes: Disregard舎(捨) the root本 cause and chase逐 the end末 results
row.jpn: 物事の根幹となることをおろそかにして、つまらないことに関心をもつこと。

row.notes: Many衆 and few寡 are not不 (evenly matched) enemies敵
row.jpn: 少数は多数にかなわない。

row.notes: Grief愁 suffering苦 painful辛 trying勤
row.jpn: ひじょうに憂え苦しむこと。

row.notes: Prisoner囚 head首 (hair uncombed) and mourning喪 period face面 (unwashed)
row.jpn: 容貌を飾らないことのたとえ。

row.kun: 身(み)を修(おさ)め、家(いえ)を斉(ととの)う
row.english: To serve others, you must first perfect the self
row.notes: Train修 your body身 to organize斉 your home家. A concept in Confucianism regarding governing that teaches you must first perfect the self and then get your domestic affairs in order before you can attempt to rule over others.
row.jpn: 自分の身を修め行いを正し円満な家庭を築くこと。

row.reading: しゅうそうさんじゃく
row.notes: Cold and shining like autumn秋 frost霜. Three三 shaku尺 is roughly 3 feet long.
row.jpn: 研ぎすました刀剣。

row.notes: [All around>周 known知 thoroughly徹底 throughout society
row.jpn: 世間一般、広くてみずみまで知れわたるようにすること。

row.notes: [Name succession>襲名 reveal披露. This is when an actor officially takes on the name of their parent or master.
row.jpn: 親または師匠の名前を継いだことを公表すること。

row.english: All living beings can be saved through the teachings of Buddhism
row.notes: 衆生 is all living things. 済度 is salvation through Buddhist teachings.
row.jpn: 仏道によって行きているものすべてを迷いから救い、悟りの境地へ導くこと。

row.notes: Heart心 is chaotic like a monkey猿, mind意 is racing like a horse馬
row.jpn: 煩悩や妄念のために心が乱れ落ち着かないことのたとえ。

row.english: Too early to act on an opportunity
row.notes: Time時期 is now尚 too early早
row.jpn: ある事を行うには、まだ時期が早すぎる。

row.notes: You自 get得 what you deserve based on what you自 do業
row.jpn: 自分から出たものは自分にかえるという意。

row.notes: Binding縛 yourself自 with your own自 cords縄
row.jpn: 自分の心がけや言動によって、動きがとれなくなり苦しむこと。

row.english: Learning by doing; Gaining hands-on experience
row.notes: 事上 means while doing actual work or tasks. 磨錬 is to polish and temper, or metaphorically improve oneself. Wang Yangming (王陽明) of the Ming明 dynasty believed that more than sitting quietly and studying, real learning was done through direct experience of daily work.
row.jpn: 実際に行動や実践をしながら知識や精神をみがき修養すること。

row.notes: Vertical縦 smearing塗 of ink and horizontal横 rubbing抹 to erase errors
row.jpn: 乱暴に書きなぐること。

row.notes: The flexible柔 has the ability能 to subdue制 the strong剛
row.jpn: 弱いものがかえって強い者に打ち勝つ。

row.english: Acting freely, doing as you please
row.notes: 自由 is freedom. 奔放 is running around unrestrained.
row.jpn: 気がねなしに自分の思うままに行動するさま。

row.english: A landscape or nation ravaged by war
row.notes: Only rivers水 and mountains山 remain剰・残
row.jpn: 戦乱のあとに残った荒廃した山や川の自然。

row.notes: A plan案 to use fireflies蛍 and snow雪 on the window窓 to study
row.jpn: 苦労して勉学に励むこと

row.notes: From a story where a baby monkey is taken on a ship. The mother monkey chases desperately after the ship, leaps on board, and dies immediately. When they cut her open, they see her intestines腸 had torn断 apart from grief
row.jpn: 腸がちぎれるような激しい悲しみや苦しみのこと
